description: After the patch for CVE-2024-38191 is applied, users may notice unexpected behavior related to access rights within the operating system, particularly in environments utilizing the Windows Kernel Streaming Service. Administrators could observe increased requests for access to elevated privileges, which may be indicative of an underlying issue triggered by the patch. Additionally, systems might display erratic behavior where certain applications are unable to run due to insufficient privileges, leading to operational disruptions. The affected systems include Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2012 variations, which have KB Articles such as KB5040497 and KB5040485 associated with this patch. The impact underlines the importance of applying updates while being aware of potential changes in system behavior following installation, especially regarding user rights and system stability.
